The Birth Story of Catuposathiya (1)
“The one who doesn’t get angry when there’s reason to be angry,
who never gets angry—he’s a good person.
Even when angry, he doesn’t do anything bad.

analyzed: tam ve naram samaṇam āhu loke
translated: He’s called a contemplative in the world.”
“The one who, with an empty stomach, endures hunger,
tamed, practicing austerities, eating and drinking in moderation,
who doesn’t do anything bad for the sake of food—

analyzed: tam ve naram samaṇam āhu loke
translated: he’s called a contemplative in the world.”

“We ask the one with a mind of wisdom, the doer,
we have a dispute in our conversation.
Cut through our doubts and uncertainties today.
Today we all will spread out our doubts.”
“Those who are wise, who are benefactors of the world,
Speak appropriately at the right time.

The garuḍa, the descendant of Veṇu, of little food.
The king of gandhabbas speaks of the abandonment of pleasure,
The best of Kurus’ kings of being without possessions.”
